name: Skomer Island
best_time: Daytime for Puffins, Night for Shearwaters
description: Famous for its puffins (April-July) and the world's largest population of Manx Shearwaters. Also grey seals.

name: Skokholm Island
description: A wilder, more rugged alternative to Skomer. Huge seabird colonies including puffins and storm petrels.

name: Ramsey Island
description: One of the best places in the UK to see grey seal pups in autumn. Also choughs and peregrines.

name: Grassholm Island
description: Home to 39,000 pairs of gannets, turning the island white. Spectacular boat trip destination.

name: New Quay (Cardigan Bay)
description: The best place in Wales to see bottlenose dolphins from land or boat trips. Resident pod.

name: Mwnt
description: A secluded cove where dolphins are frequently seen playing in the bay. High cliffs offer great vantage points.

name: Gigrin Farm Red Kite Centre
description: Spectacular daily feeding of hundreds of red kites. Hides available for photography.

name: Bwlch Nant yr Arian
description: Forestry England site with daily red kite feeding by the lake. Stunning backdrop.

name: Dyfi Osprey Project
description: Home of the Dyfi Ospreys. Visitor centre, boardwalks and observatory.

name: Glaslyn Osprey Project
description: The first site where ospreys bred in Wales after their return. Live cameras and viewing points.

name: South Stack Cliffs
description: RSPB reserve with spectacular cliffs. Puffins (May-July), choughs, and razorbills.

name: Cemlyn Bay
description: Important breeding colony for Sandwich, Arctic and Common Terns in the lagoon.

name: Newborough Forest
description: One of the best places to see red squirrels in Wales. Pine forest next to dunes.

name: Puffin Island (Ynys Seiriol)
description: Uninhabited island with cormorant colony, seals, and some puffins. Boat trips from Beaumaris.

name: Great Orme
description: Famous for its wild Kashmir goats. Also grey seals at Angel Bay (Little Orme nearby).

name: Angel Bay (Little Orme)
description: Accessible viewing of grey seals on the pebble beach below cliffs. Do not descend to beach.

name: Bosherston Lily Ponds
description: Famous lily ponds that are a good spot for seeing otters hunting.

name: Teifi Marshes
description: Welsh Wildlife Centre. Otters in the river, water buffalo grazing the marsh.

name: Gilfach Nature Reserve
description: Otters can be seen hunting salmon leaping up the waterfalls in autumn.

name: Worm's Head
description: Seals haul out on the rocks. Accessible only at low tide - check times carefully.

name: Point of Ayr
description: RSPB reserve. High tide roost for thousands of waders like knot and dunlin.

name: Newport Wetlands
description: RSPB reserve with reedbeds. Good for bearded tits, avocets, and bitterns.

name: Kenfig National Nature Reserve
description: Huge dune system. Home to the rare Fen Orchid and diverse birdlife.

name: Elan Valley
description: 'Welsh Lake District'. Good for raptors, red kites, and peregrines.

name: Lake Vyrnwy
description: RSPB reserve. Peregrines on the dam, pied flycatchers in the woods.

name: RSPB Ynys-hir
description: Diverse mix of oak woodland and saltmarsh. BBC Springwatch location.

name: RSPB Conwy
description: Wetland reserve on the estuary. Great for waders and ducks. Accessible trails.

name: Bardsey Island (Ynys Enlli)
description: 'Island of 20,000 Saints'. Huge Manx Shearwater colony and grey seals.

name: Gwaith Powdwr
description: North Wales Wildlife Trust reserve. Good for adders, slow worms, and nightjars.

name: Cors Goch
description: Wildlife Trust reserve. Fenland with orchids and red squirrels.

name: Goldcliff Lagoons
description: Part of the Gwent Levels. Excellent for waders.
